verses.roman:
yāvan na me hato bāṇaiḥ
śayīthā muñca dārīkām
smayan kṛṣṇo dhanuś chittvā
ṣaḍbhir vivyādha rukmiṇam

synonyms: yāvat—while; na—not; me—my; hataḥ—killed; bāṇaiḥ—by the arrows; śayīthaḥ—you lie down; muñca—release; dārīkām—the girl; smayan—smiling; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; dhanuḥ—his bow; chittvā—breaking; ṣaḍbhiḥ—with six (arrows); vivyādha—pierced; rukmiṇam—Rukmī.
translation: "Release the girl before You are struck dead by my arrows and made to lie down!" In response to this, Lord Kṛṣṇa smiled, and with six arrows He struck Rukmī and broke his bow.

purport.content: Śrīla Viśvanātha Cakravartī points out that in fact Lord Kṛṣṇa was meant to lie down together with Rukmiṇī on a beautiful bed of flowers, but out of shyness Rukmī did not directly mention this point.
